main_definition: A changelog is a record of all notable changes made to a project, software, or system over time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Version control history in software development
meanings_and_examples.example: The changelog for the latest version of our web application includes bug fixes, new features, and performance improvements.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A record of changes made to a document or project
meanings_and_examples.example: Before submitting your report for review, make sure to update the changelog with any revisions you've made.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An accounting of modifications in software updates or releases
meanings_and_examples.example: The changelog for our app states that version 2.0 has added a new user interface, improved loading speed, and enhanced security features.
